AVSEC CIRCULAR NO. 18 / 2009 
 
Subject: Courtesy  to Members of Parliament at airports 
 
 
 
It has been brought to the notice of this Bureau that Hon’ble Members of 
Parliament often face inconvenience at airports during their journeys. 
 
2. 
In view of the above, the following instructions shall be implemented by all 
concerned strictly:  
(i) 
Hon’ble Members of Parliament shall be allowed entry into the 
passengers terminal buildings (upto check-in and baggage claim 
areas) of civil airport/ civil enclave in the country on the basis of 
their valid identity cards issued by Parliament Secretariat, New 
Delhi. 
 
(ii) 
One time airport entry permit shall be issued to one personal staff 
of each Hon’ble Member of Parliament whenever requested for 
receiving/seeing-off of the Hon’ble MP. 
 
(iii) 
The CISF personnel / APSU staff and persons of various agencies 
deployed at civil airports/civil enclaves in India shall ensure that due 
courtesy is extended to Hon’ble Members of Parliament during their 
visit to airports.  
 
(iv) 
CASO/APSU I/c at each airport shall personally brief to the 
personnel under their command on the above points. Extra care 
should be taken to brief all staff newly joined. 
 
3. 
All airport directors, airport operators shall also ensure strict compliance of 
these instructions.  
 
4. 
This issues with approval of COS(CA) and supersedes BCAS Circular 
Nos. 15/2003 dated 16/6/2003, 01/2004 dated 06.1.2004 ,02/2004 dated 
23.1.2004 and 10/2007 dated 19-10-2007. 
 
 
(M.Malaviya, IPS) 
Addl. Commissioner of Security (CA)
